text: Croatia competed in the Winter Olympic Games for the first time as an independent nation at the 1992 Winter Olympics in Albertville, France. Previously, Croatian athletes had competed for Yugoslavia at the Olympic Games. ==Alpine skiing== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Run 1 (DH) !colspan="2"|Run 2 (Sl) !colspan="2"|Run 3 (Sl) !colspan="3"|Final/Total |- !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Diff !Rank |-align="center" |align="left" rowspan=3|Vedran Pavlek |align="left" |Men's Super-G |colspan=6 |colspan=3|Did not finish |-align="center" |align="left" |Men's giant slalom |colspan=4|Did not finish |colspan=2 |colspan=3|Did not finish |-align="center" |align="left" |Men's slalom |58.75 |44 |58.53 |36 |colspan=2 |1:57.28 | +12.89 |36 |-align="center" |} == Cross-country skiing== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Race |- !Time !Rank |-align="center" |align="left" rowspan=3|Siniša Vukonić |align="left"|Men's 10 km classical |34:01.1 |75 |-align="center" |align="left"|Men's 15 km freestyle pursuit |48:45.5 |69 |-align="center" |align="left"|Men's 50 km classical |2:28:19.4 |60 |} ==Figure skating== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- ! rowspan="2"|Athlete(s) ! rowspan="2"|Event ! ! ! / ! / ! colspan="2"|Total |- ! ! ! ! ! !Rank |-align="center" |align="left"|Tomislav Čižmešija |align="left"|Men's |colspan=2 |29 |colspan=3|Did not advance |-align="center" |align="left"|Željka Čižmešija |align="left"|Ladies' |colspan=2 |25 |colspan=3|Did not advance |} ==References== ==External links== *Official Olympic Reports Category:Nations at the 1992 Winter Olympics 1992
title: Croatia at the 1992 Winter Olympics
